result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Barber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: All conditions of probation shall remain the same for Extended Supervision.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall not be present where controlled substances are illegally purchased, sold or consumed.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall notify Probation Agent of any prescriptions.
Defendant shall notify health care providers of addiction history.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Def appears in custody & w/Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.  Resolution reached; State moves to dismiss and read in Ct. 2 and 15TR1498 and Court so orders.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 1.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing; colloquy w/ defendant.  Court accepts waiver and binds defendant over for trial.  State files information, reading waived.  Defense motions for modification of bond.  State objects.  Court denies motion.   Arraignment scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Per Atty. Armbrust, Defendant no longer wishes to proceed to preliminary hearing and will waive time limits at 7-10-15 hearing.
Absolute sobriety; Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription

Def appears in custody & w/Atty. Alyssa Armbrust from the State Public Defenders Office.  Intern Samuel Tufford with Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for the State.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  State requests cash bond.  Argument on bond.  $500 cash bond set.  Defendant does not waive preliminary hearing time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
